FYI, the heat shield on the back isn't just heat shield, it's actually a movable body flap that helps maintain the pitch of the orbiter. Fun trivia, the body flap was damaged during STS-1's launch due to insufficient sound suppression, but it wasn't discovered until after Columbia had landed. John Young reportedly said that if they had know of the damage during launch, he'd have ejected because the orbiter should have been uncontrollable during reentry!
